repnme.cdata!:
Jordan - Reduction of Consumption of
            Ozone-depleting Substances Project (First ODS Phaseout Project)

abstracts.cdata!:
The Reduction of Consumption of
            Ozone-Depleting Substances (ODS) Project achieved its ODS
            phase out target successfully. The key lessons from the
            ODS-1 project have particular relevance for the
            implementation of the ODS-2 and future subprojects. 1) The
            overall timetable for project implementation was not viable.
            A minimum of 30 months should be provided for the
            implementation of each project. 2) The project suffered from
            the haste in preparing the data on production, consumption
            of ODS and baseline equipment as well as sub-project
            preparation. There was shortage of aerosol and foam experts
            in the field causing delays in sub-project processing. 3)
            Close cooperation and coordination among government entities
            proved vital in the smooth implementation of the project. 4)
            The Bank has to review its policy regarding the application
            of its guidelines and procedures to all projects funded by
            the donors. The Montreal Protocol has their own guidelines
            and procedures. This causes some uncertainty to the Borrower.
